snippet: The regulations are a piece of President Obama’s effort to address the racial disparities he says are helping fuel unrest in American cities.
abstract: Obama administration announces new rules that require cities and localities to describe how they will use federal housing funds to reduce racial disparities, part of effort to encourage affordable housing development in more affluent neighborhoods and improve housing in lower-income areas; cities and localities will face penalties if they do not follow rules.

byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and BINYAMIN APPELBAUM

lead_paragraph: The regulations are a piece of President Obama’s effort to address the racial disparities he says are helping fuel unrest in American cities.

headline.main: Obama Unveils Stricter Rules Against Segregation in Housing
headline.print_headline: Obama Unveils Stricter Rules on Fair Housing
